publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3527 David Stewart: European Victims’ Week—That the Parliament notes that 19 to 24 February 2009 is European Victims’ Week; further notes the findings of the European Union Crime and Safety Study that showed that in 2005 Britain had the highest coverage rate of support agencies for crime victims, with Scotland topping the league table of countries providing specialist support to victims of crime; acknowledges the hard work undertaken by all the individuals and agencies who provide a high quality of service to victims of crime, and encourages the Scottish Government to support Victim Support Scotland’s call to establish a victims’ commissioner for Scotland.
S3M-3527 European Victims’ Week (lodged on 24 February 2009) David Whitton*, Mary Mulligan*, Sarah Boyack*, Rhoda Grant*, Elaine Murray*, Hugh Henry*, Robin Harper*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-3527 European Victims’ Week (lodged on 24 February 2009) Ken Macintosh*, Irene Oldfather*, Jackie Baillie*

S3M-3527 David Stewart: European Victims’ Week—That the Parliament notes that 19 to 24 February 2009 is European Victims’ Week; further notes the findings of the European Union Crime and Safety Study that showed that in 2005 Britain had the highest coverage rate of support agencies for crime victims, with Scotland topping the league table of countries providing specialist support to victims of crime; acknowledges the hard work undertaken by all the individuals and agencies who provide a high quality of service to victims of crime, and encourages the Scottish Government to support Victim Support Scotland’s call to establish a victims’ commissioner for Scotland. Supported by: David Whitton, Mary Mulligan, Sarah Boyack, Rhoda Grant, Elaine Murray, Hugh Henry, Robin Harper, Mr Frank McAveety, Ken Macintosh, Irene Oldfather, Jackie Baillie, John Park*
